channel.title: Excel on Reside-IC
channel.description: Recent content in Excel on Reside-IC

item.title: Experiments in transforming Excel into R
item.description: Last week was the Health Economics in R Hackathon, bringing together health economists, epidemiologists and research software engineers. We learned that complex spreadsheet models are common in health economics, and that the users of these models feel constrained by what they can achieve with them - having constructed a decision tree model in Excel, the analyst might want to carry out a sensitivity analysis, varying the models’ parameters to see how the model outcomes vary.
